ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Knowledge of the German Language and how to speak, read and write German.
Better studying and time management skills
Reviewed the German I learned in L1 and L2, learned about applications and cultures.

German 140 helped me improve my German skills in listening, reading comprehension, speaking, and writing. I also learned a lot about German culture, as the course was structured so that each unit covered one German city and the cultural aspects associated with it. We also learned about important issues such as immigration aid and racism/xenophobia in Germany, as well as other current events.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Group setting, slides posted to CANVAS, enthusiastic teaching staff
Weaknesses: The % needed for specific grades are a little too high. Students are prewriting speaking task responses and are more concerned about achieving a specific grade than actually learning the language as a consequence.

The course was very highly organized and as a result easy to engage with. We had weekly practices on Mindtap and spent class time doing worksheets, watching movies, and participating in class discussions. Ways it could be improved are to have more resources, such as opportunities to speak with other German speakers (outside of the regular Kaffeeklatsch hours since the time can be a conflict sometimes), recommend sites to practice and learn new vocabulary, etc.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It depends. I really enjoyed taking this class. However, it is more challenging relative to other languages on offer. For someone interested in actually learning German, yes, for someone who just wants language credits, probably not.
Yes I would. Its definitely difficult but if you are interested in the language it is a good course
Yes, if wanting to review German
Yes! This is a great class to not only improve German skills but also learn more about German culture and the vocabulary/grammar needed to talk deeply about it.
